intro: Alseodaphne panduriformis, commonly known as the broadleaf sandalwood, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, including parts of Malaysia, Indonesia, and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its fruit is a drupe, containing a single seed, and it plays a role in local ecosystems as a habitat and food source. Due to overharvesting, it is also considered a threatened species in some regions.
